IntApp Going Virtual
Last year at ILTA, we announced the virtualization of our entire product line. Many firms have already migrated from hardware to pure-software, or are in the process of doing so. "The process of getting virtualized with IntApp was extremely easy," said Adam Klein at Loeb & Loeb.
There are several advantages to going virtual -- including improved performance and reduced infrastructure costs -- and IntApp stands ready to help. If you would like more information, please contact Neal Vora at Neal.Vora@intapp.com.
Virtualizing Firms: Best Best & Krieger LLP Cozen O'Connor Cummings & Lockwood LLC Fennemore Craig P.C. Garvey, Schubert & Barer K&L Gates LLP Lane Powell PC Marshall, Gerstein & Borun LLP Sheppard Mullin Richter & Hampton LLP
IntApp Webinars
We ran a webinar about the benefits of running a Master Data Directory (MDD) this quarter. The MDD serves as a data hub that eliminates the complexity of data management. It ensures that data across applications is consistent and standardized. Mark Raabe, Director of Application Services at Faegre & Benson LLP, and his team talked about his firm's experience building an MDD. If you missed the webinar, you can view Mark's presentation on our website at http://www.intapp.com/products/ibwebinars.html. We have also established several threads on the IntApp customer community where firms are sharing their own best practices for building and extending a Master Data Directory. The threads can be viewed at https://www.intapp.com/community/index.php?name=PNphpBB2&file=viewforum&f=27.
We also ran a webinar about the benefits running IntApp software in a virtual environment. The webinar featured a case study presentation by Ramin Pakravan, Manager of Information Technology Systems Design, Engineering, and Development at Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, LLP, who spoke about his firm's decision to virtualize and the process of virtualizing IntApp. If you missed the webinar, you can view Mr. Pakravan's presentation on our website at http://www.intapp.com/products/ibwebinars.html.
New IntApp Team Members
IntApp welcomes Mark Burgard as the Director of Client Relations. Mark brings two decades of software development, implementation and project management experience to IntApp, including twelve years focused on the legal industry. A certified Project Management Professional (PMP), he is an expert in managing complex enterprise software implementations. Most recently, he served as Director of Global Services for Open Text Corporation’s eDocs content management and LegalKEY conflicts and records management lines of business. Prior to Open Text, he held several senior technology and project management positions at Bryan Cave LLP, a global law firm composed of more than 1100 attorneys. Several IntApp clients have worked with him in the past, and he's excited to connect with the IntApp community. He can be reached at Mark.Burgard@intapp.com
Time Builder Adoption Program
Given the current economic environment, interest remains high in IntApp Time Builder. For current Time Builder clients, we have developed new training and adoption resources to make sure they get the most out of their investment. These resources will help firms implement a successful roll out of the software and maximize adoption. Materials include an implementation overview, internal marketing, a training syllabus, a Time Builder Handbook and feedback forms. Additionally, if your firm is an approved MCLE provider, your Time Builder training classes could qualify for CLE credit. Best Best & Krieger LLP has already acquired CLE credit for their Time Builder training course. We would like to thank their trainer, Dalene Leach, for sharing the process they followed to qualify for CLE credit and encouraging us to incorporate it into our adoption program materials..
If you are a current Time Builder customer who would like to receive a copy of the adoption materials or if you are interested in learning more about Time Builder contact your account manager.

IntApp Announces Time Builder Support for PensEra TimeKM
IntApp has added TimeKM to the roster of time entry applications supported by Time Builder. PensEra Knowledge Technologies specializes in developing practical technology solutions for the legal profession. Its TimeKM suite of products delivers a total tracking environment designed specifically for the work habits of the busy professional, while addressing the business challenges of the modern firm. Its simplicity, scalability, extensibility, and integration platform allows firms to capture more with less effort, while better managing the firm's most important asset - Time.
"IntApp is the leader in time capture software for law firms, and we’re pleased to partner with them to integrate Time Builder and TimeKM," said Peter Zver, CEO of PensEra Knowledge Technologies. "TimeKM and Time Builder working together deliver the best legal industry solution for maximizing both the capture and management of the firms' time inventory asset, resulting in some very impressive financial results for firms."
For more information about PensEra, visit http://www.timekm.com.
IntApp Partners with EIM International
We're pleased to welcome EIM to the growing community of certified IntApp services partners.
EIM International, a leading provider of information and document management software and services, has signed on as an authorized reseller of IntApp Wall Builder. EIM provides mission-critical services and technology solutions to customers in all areas of document and knowledge management, from initial planning through final implementation, to streamline business processes and increase efficiency. EIM is well-known and highly acclaimed throughout the ECM software community.
Through the partnership, EIM International will offer Wall Builder software and implementation services to its law firm clients.
For more information about EIM International, visit http://www.eimintl.com.
